content: 2017 Singaporean TV series or program ***Patisserie Fighting*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 我的甜蜜革命) is a 2017 Singaporean web-drama series by Mediacorp Toggle. An eight-episode drama about baking, it stars Singaporean singer-actress [Kit Chan](/wiki/Kit_Chan) and Taiwanese actor [Chris Lee](/wiki/Chris_Lee_(Taiwanese_actor)). After more than a decade-long acting hiatus, this drama also marks Chan's first drama after the 2002's *[Cash Is King](/wiki/Cash_Is_King_(TV_series))*. ## Synopsis See Yu Tin ([Kit Chan](/wiki/Kit_Chan)), a biomedical researcher, quits her job of 20 years to fulfil her dream of being a pastry chef. One day, she chances upon a mystery pastry. Determined to discover the recipe, she tracks down the gifted yet reclusive pastry chef from Taiwan, Wu Wen Di or Hsiao D ([Chris Lee](/wiki/Chris_Lee_(Taiwanese_actor))), and asks to be his apprentice. ## Cast - [Kit Chan](/wiki/Kit_Chan) as See Yu Tin (施语恬) - [Chris Lee](/wiki/Chris_Lee_Chih-cheng) as Wu Wen Di (吴文迪) / Hsiao D (小 D) ## Production **This section is empty.** You can help by adding to it. *(April 2023)* This Singaporean television-related article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Patisserie Fighting
